title: Five Nights at Freddy's TD Tier List
description: Discover the best and worst animatronics in Five Nights at Freddy's TD with our detailed tier list. From S-tier powerhouses like Golden Freddy to underperforming units like Shadow Freddy, find out which characters dominate the game.
heading: Five Nights at Freddy's TD Tier List
introText: Discover the best and worst animatronics in Five Nights at Freddy's TD with our detailed tier list. From S-tier powerhouses like Golden Freddy to underperforming units like Shadow Freddy, find out which characters dominate the game.

data.itemDescription: A meta AoE tower with excellent range, extremely high DPS, and a 0.1-second cooldown; only one can be placed, balancing its low cost
Its attacks include a DoT effect that significantly boosts DPS, presenting a solid overall choice
An AoE burn unit with stun capabilities; while its stats are lower and upgrades more costly than Scarecrow Foxy, the added utility compensates
A continuous splash/slow unit with exceptional DPS and utility, though it's the only Apex rarity unit, making it very expensive
Features a large AoE attack, poison effect, solid DPS, and a 3-placement limit; its main limitation is very low range, which can be mitigated with supports and enchants
A strong Pierce unit with impressive DPS, firing five piercing projectiles per attack; however, it has a maximum placement of only two
Remains a viable single-target DPS option, notable for its affordability in placement and upgrades
Capable of stunning and dealing solid damage, but a high cooldown reduces the effectiveness of its stun ability
Delivers napalm attacks at a rapid rate, providing high DPS with AoE and burn effects
Gunslinger Endo has one of the highest single-target DPSs in FNTD. Plus, its cheap upgrades make it viable even for the mid-game. The only downside is its low range
Nightmare Bonnie has one of the highest single-target DPSs in FNTD. However, you’ll need something to increase her range and make her broken
Circus Baby can stun enemies with her splash attacks, which can be extremely useful. However, her long cooldown is preventing her from being a really top-tier unit
Shadow Bonnie is an almost 50% stronger version of Blighted Endo Freddy, though with a shorter range. It also has a very high cost, but that won’t be a problem in Endless
An upgrade over Leviathan Mangle, offering higher DPS, increased placement, and longer range; however, crafting it requires extensive farming
A splash unit with solid stats and burn damage, ranking among the highest in raw DPS
A top-tier evolution with a Pierce attack and impressive DPS, though outperformed by Fractured Bonnie against single targets
Offers significantly higher DPS than Valkyrie Chica, making it the top single-target DPS unit in the game
Single-target DPS-wise, Phantom Mangle is pretty solid. But it’s still far from being as good as Valkyrie Chica and others
Leviathan Mangle is a pretty solid Pierce unit. It’s perfect for dealing with multiple enemies, and its single-target DPS isn’t too shabby, either
Boasts broken-level damage, arguably the strongest unit currently available
Wraith Freddy is an insanely good full AoE unit. His DPS matches that of Withered Endo Freddy, and you get one more placement. The only downside is its relatively short range
Features very good range, full AoE, and one of the highest base damage stats, justifying its high placement cost
Tuned Mangle is better than regular Mangle but still far from being OP. The best thing about it is its big splash AoE
Spectral Chica is several times better than Phantom Chica and has a high DPS and range
Clowntrap does have a splash stun, but its DPS and cooldown are fairly underwhelming. Consider it a worse version of Circus Baby
Foxy’s slow is the only thing making it somewhat viable. Otherwise, there are better DPS units you can use
Tangle got nerfed big time and it’s now a pretty mediocre end-game unit. Still, you can get it for free through the Battlepass
While having lower DPS than Goliath Endo Freddy, its exceptional range can lead to superior performance depending on the map

A full AoE unit with good range and solid DPS; its performance is slightly better than Marionette, making it a debatable investment. 
Marionette’s Puppeteer: A cost-effective option with high AoE DPS when fully upgraded, despite relatively low range
Stats-wise, Bounded Shadow is one of the better Pierce towers in FNTD due to its DPS. However, the low range and only 2 maximum placements balance it out
Possesses a cone AoE attack dealing 10K damage when fully upgraded, with a relatively short SPA; its only drawback is somewhat limited range

Withered Bonnie is basically a single-target, long-range version of Shadow Freddy. Her stats are a bit worse than those of other end-game units. However, you can get her relatively cheaply, making her a solid overall investment
Combines continuous unit DPS with a splash attack and excellent range, currently one of the most overpowered units
Plane Boy is one of the most expensive units to place in Five Nights TD. The range and DPS it has are good. However, the 2 placement count makes it straight-up worse than Phantom Mangle and the like
Enforcer Bonnie is basically the same as Valkyrie Chica, though it has worse stats. However, you can also pull it with a 5x higher probability than Chica, bringing its price down
Phantom Puppet is a worse and more expensive version of Leviathan Mangle
Abyssal Foxy’s slow is the only thing making it somewhat viable. Otherwise, there are better DPS units you can use
Nightmare has a big AoE and poison. However, its DPS is not high enough to make it a top-tier tower
A late-game version of Scott, featuring amazing range, high DPS, and a 3-placement limit, making it exceptionally strong
A superior version of Rave Demon Bonnie, with a single placement making it cost-effective
Among the best evolutions, offering excellent DPS and range, though it comes with a relatively high cost
Despite a demanding crafting recipe, its DPS, range, and splash radius can justify the effort
Offers one of the highest DPS figures but is limited by single-target attacks, making it less versatile than units like Dreadbear or Scarecrow Foxy
Similar to Astral Bonnie with slightly lower stats, yet remains among the top units available
